repnme.cdata!:
Paraguay - Modernization of the Ministry of
            Finance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Paraguay Modernization
            of the Ministry of Finance Project were as follows: the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was moderately unsatisfactory. The factor leading to the
            cancellation of the loan was that prospects for obtaining
            timely congressional approval of the loan appeared to be
            remote and the Bank declined a Government proposal to extend
            the deadline for effectiveness by an additional six months
            beyond end-2006. Further discussions with the Government did
            not succeed in remedying the problem, and in March 2007, the
            Bank management decided to cancel the Loan Agreement. The
            main lesson learned is that changes in Paraguay's
            political conditions can critically affect project,
            effectiveness, implementation and achievement of project objectives.

Paraguay - Modernization of the Ministry of
            Finance Project

7050124.trustfund:
TF053141-PHRD-PARAGUAY: STRENGTHENING
            MINISTRY OF FINANCE,TF030648-SPANISH CTF - FY05 ( LATIN
            AMERICA & CARIBBEAN REGION/FINANCIAL & PRIVA

repnme.cdata!:
Paraguay - Modernization of the Ministry of
            Finance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Modernization of the Ministry of
            Finance Project for Paraguay aims at improving fiscal
            sustainability and quality of public expenditures through
            the strengthening of its core functions and
            responsibilities, and the improvement of internal
            administrative and financial management systems, so as to
            enable the Ministry of Finance (MoF) to assist the
            Government in the reform of its public sector. The project
            has the following four components: Component 1) will support
            the improvement of fiscal and economic planning for policy
            formulation, implementation and monitoring. Component 2)
            will provide technical assistance for the diagnosis, design
            and implementation of organization reforms, training and
            monitoring for: change management, process streamlining,
            information management, human resources management, and
            internal control and auditing. Component 3) will support:
            transparency, civil society participation, and
            communications. Component 4) The Project Coordination Unit
            (PCU) will provide support to the Ministry of Finance in
            designing, implementing and monitoring policies and
            institutional reforms.
